intro: Bignonia rhodosantha, commonly known as the scarlet bignonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a deciduous vine characterized by its vibrant orange-red tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for gardens in warm climates. Its showy blooms attract hummingbirds and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological value.
